intro: Calonemorchis valida, commonly known as the valid calonemorchis, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, which includes many diverse and ornamental species. The plant features slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, intricate flowers with a unique coloration pattern. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and requires careful cultivation due to its specific ecological needs. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
